Title: Bayesian Ordinal Regression for High-Dimensional Data
Available models: Logistic (cumulative)
Citation: Archer, K. J., Seffernick, A. E., Sun, S., & Zhang, Y. (2022). ordinalbayes: Fitting Ordinal Bayesian Regression Models to High-Dimensional Data Using R. Stats, 5(2), 371-384.

Title: Bayesian Group Sequential Design for Ordinal Data
Available models: Logistic(cumulative)
Citation: Zhong C, Pan H, Miao H (2022). _BayesOrdDesign: Bayesian Group Sequential Design for Ordinal Data_. R package version 0.1.2, <https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=BayesOrdDesign>.

Title: Item Response Theory Modeling and Scoring for Judgment Data
Available models: Partial credit model, graded response model
Citation: Myszkowski, N. (2021). Development of the R library jrt: Automated item response theory procedures for judgment data and their application with the consensual assessment technique. Psychology of Aesthetics, Creativity and the Arts, 15(3), 426-438.

Title: Machine Learning Models and Tools
Available models: Logistic (cumulative), probit, log-log and complementary log-log, cauchit
Citation: Smith BJ (2023). _MachineShop: Machine Learning Models and Tools_. R package version 3.7.0, <https://cran.r-project.org/package=MachineShop>.

Title: Transformation Models
Available models: Logistic (cumulative), probit, log-log and complementary log-log, cauchit
Citation: Hothorn T, Möst L, Bühlmann P (2018). “Most Likely Transformations.” _Scandinavian Journal of Statistics_, *45*(1), 110-134.

Citation: Goodrich B, Gabry J, Ali I, Brilleman S (2023). “rstanarm: Bayesian applied regression modeling via Stan.” R package version 2.26.1

Title: Penalized Ordinal Regression

Title: Bayesian Regression Models using 'Stan'

Title: Ordinal Regression for High-Dimensional Data
Available models: Logistic (cumulative, adjacent categories, forward and backward continuation ratio, stereotype model)

Title: Feature Selection (Including Multiple Solutions) and Bayesian Networks

Title: Regression Modeling Strategies

Title: MCMC Generalised Linear Mixed Models
Available models: Probit
Citation: Hadfield JD (2010). “MCMC Methods for Multi-Response Generalized Linear Mixed Models: The MCMCglmm R Package.” Journal of Statistical Software, 33(2), 1–22.
Other observations:
*As in the proportional odds model with the logit link, the effect ß is the same for each cumulative probability. But it is not appropriate to call this model a "proportional odds" model because probit
model interpretations do not apply to odds or to odds ratios (Agresti, 2010).

Title: Data Analysis Using Regression and Multilevel/Hierarchical Models
Available models: Logistic(cumulative), probit, cloglog, cauchit
Citation: Gelman A, Su Y (2022). _arm: Data Analysis Using Regression and Multilevel/Hierarchical Models_. R package version 1.13-1, <https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=arm>.

Title: Vector Generalized Linear and Additive Models
Primary function(s): vglm  + (a) acat, (b) cratio, (c) cumulative, (d) propodds, (e) sratio
Available models: Totes combinacions
Citation: Thomas W. Yee (2010). The VGAM Package for Categorical Data Analysis. Journal of Statistical Software, 32(10), 1-34. DOI: 10.18637/jss.v032.i10

Title: Generalized Nonlinear Regression Models
